data.title: Ameriprise Financial, Inc. Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Ameriprise Financial, Inc. reported earnings results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 493 million compared to USD 409 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 4,893 million compared to USD 4,560 million a year ago.

Net income was USD 912 million compared to USD 511 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 9.47 compared to USD 5.09 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 9.33 compared to USD 5 a year ago.

data.title: Former MI6 Chief Sawers on Global Security
data.description:
John Sawers, former Chief at the UK Secret Intelligence Service, discusses the outlook for the global security landscape. He speaks with Haslinda Amin from the sidelines of the Barclays Asia Forum in Singapore.

Bloomberg videos, provided by MT Newswires

data.title: Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 3,007 million compared to USD 3,033 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 2,411 million compared to USD 2,349 million a year ago. Net income was USD 816 million compared to USD 657 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.43 compared to USD 1.15 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.42 compared to USD 1.14 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 9,498 million compared to USD 8,731 million a year ago. Revenue was USD 7,427 million compared to USD 6,956 million a year ago. Net income was USD 2,464 million compared to USD 2,056 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 4.3 compared to USD 3.59 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 4.28 compared to USD 3.57 a year ago.

data.title: EMCOR Group, Inc. Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
EMCOR Group, Inc. reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 4,301.53 million compared to USD 3,696.92 million a year ago. Net income was USD 295.37 million compared to USD 270.26 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 6.59 compared to USD 5.83 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 6.57 compared to USD 5.8 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 12,473.3 million compared to USD 10,796.1 million a year ago. Net income was USD 838.21 million compared to USD 714.98 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 18.59 compared to USD 15.27 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 18.53 compared to USD 15.21 a year ago.

data.title: Fox Corporation Reports Earnings Results for the First Quarter Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
Fox Corporation reported earnings results for the first quarter ended September 30, 2025. For the first quarter, the company reported sales was USD 3,738 million compared to USD 3,564 million a year ago. Net income was USD 599 million compared to USD 827 million a year ago.

Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 1.32 compared to USD 1.78 a year ago.

APi Group Corporation Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
APi Group Corporation reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 2,085 million compared to USD 1,826 million a year ago. Net income was USD 93 million compared to USD 69 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.2 compared to USD 0.15 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.2 compared to USD 0.15 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 5,794 million compared to USD 5,157 million a year ago. Net income was USD 205 million compared to USD 183 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.44 compared to basic loss per share from continuing operations of USD 0.49 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.43 compared to diluted loss per share from continuing operations of USD 0.49 a year ago.

data.title: International Paper Company Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 30, 2025
data.description:
International Paper Company reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 30, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 6,222 million compared to USD 3,979 million a year ago. Net loss was USD 1,102 million compared to net income of USD 150 million a year ago. Basic loss per share from continuing operations was USD 0.81 compared to basic earnings per share from continuing operations of USD 0.32 a year ago. Diluted loss per share from continuing operations was USD 0.81 compared to diluted earnings per share from continuing operations of USD 0.31 a year ago. Basic loss per share was USD 2.09 compared to basic earnings per share of USD 0.43 a year ago. Diluted loss per share was USD 2.09 compared to diluted earnings per share of USD 0.42 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 17,628 million compared to USD 11,913 million a year ago. Net loss was USD 1,132 million compared to net income of USD 704 million a year ago. Basic loss per share from continuing operations was USD 0.95 compared to basic earnings per share from continuing operations of USD 1.83 a year ago. Diluted loss per share from continuing operations was USD 0.95 compared to diluted earnings per share from continuing operations of USD 1.8 a year ago. Basic loss per share was USD 2.27 compared to basic earnings per share of USD 2.02 a year ago. Diluted loss per share was USD 2.27 compared to diluted earnings per share of USD 1.99 a year ago.

data.title: Kellanova Reports Earnings Results for the Third Quarter and Nine Months Ended September 27, 2025
data.description:
Kellanova reported earnings results for the third quarter and nine months ended September 27, 2025. For the third quarter, the company reported sales was USD 3,260 million compared to USD 3,233 million a year ago. Net income was USD 309 million compared to USD 367 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.89 compared to USD 1.07 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 0.88 compared to USD 1.05 a year ago.
For the nine months, sales was USD 9,546 million compared to USD 9,625 million a year ago. Net income was USD 912 million compared to USD 978 million a year ago. Basic earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 2.63 compared to USD 2.86 a year ago. Diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was USD 2.61 compared to USD 2.83 a year ago.

Vodafone: acquires Skaylink to strengthen cloud and digital capabilities
data.description:
On Thursday Vodafone announced that it has signed a binding agreement to acquire Skaylink, a German company specializing in cloud services, digital transformation, and cybersecurity, for approximately €175m.

In a press release, the British mobile phone operator explained that the transaction is part of its strategy to accelerate growth in areas such as information system security, managed services, and cloud computing.

Skaylink, which is based in Munich and has offices throughout Germany and the rest of Europe, with a workforce of over 500 experts working on cloud migration projects using Microsoft and Amazon Web Services systems, as well as on the deployment of AI services for businesses.

Vodafone believes that these capabilities and its presence in certain markets will enable it to strengthen its digital services offering for businesses and public administrations.

The acquisition is expected to be finalized by the end of March 2026.

Vodafone plans to publish its Q1 2025/2026 results on November 11.

Chipotle continues to disappoint
data.description:
2025 is a complicated year for companies that have to deal with rising costs in an uncertain consumer environment. The fast food sector is on the front line, and Chipotle, which has steered its ship brilliantly in recent years, now finds itself caught in a vice.

The burrito chain has built its model on the claim of excellent value for money thanks to its high-quality ingredients. The first price increases to offset the surge in the cost of beef, avocados (key ingredients in Chipotle restaurant recipes), and transportation in 2022 were accepted without much protest, as customers had saved heavily during the Covid pandemic.

The following two years were marked by the dilemma of wanting to maintain margins without significantly impacting restaurant traffic. The group appears to have succeeded in this, as the last financial year was a record one in all respects: especially in terms of revenue, margins, and free cash flow. 

The backlash is now here. Some customers no longer find the value for money they once did. The younger generation in the US is affected by rising unemployment, the resumption of student loan repayments and low wage growth. This limits their spending power on leisure activities. Donald Trump's trade policies are not helping the company to source supplies either...

Chipotle has therefore reduced its 2025 targets for the third time this year. But this time, the group will have no choice but to sacrifice its margins, as price increases have already been pushed to the maximum. It can no longer afford to risk a further decline in customer traffic. In addition, internal failures have been noted, particularly in terms of cleanliness and service. Responses to these issues will also be expected in future publications. 

For the year, Chipotle anticipates a low single-digit decline in comparable store sales, which would be a first since 2015. Current growth is only being sustained by the opening of new restaurants: between 350 and 370 openings are expected next year. The group can also count on international expansion, even though competition is now fierce wherever it goes. Asia is one possibility for it.

This explains the sharp reaction in the stock and its very poor performance so far this year (-35%). Its valuation is at a ten-year low, although is still well above comparable listed companies. Visibility is currently too low. Chipotle will need to reassure its investors in 2026. Without that, the stock does not seem likely to achieve much.
